Package com.shouldis.bitset

Class BitSet

java.lang.Object
com.shouldis.bitset.BitSet
Direct Known Subclasses:
ConcurrentBitSet
public class BitSet
extends java.lang.Object
Represents a fixed number of bits stored within an internal long array, mapping positive integer indices to individual bits and facilitating the manipulation of those individual bits or ranges of bits, as well as retrieving their boolean values. Using this memory structure, this class allows grouping of multiple bitwise operations into fewer operations on the underlying long words.

The bits represented by this BitSet will either be in the live state (1, true), or the dead state (0, false).

BitSet on its own is thread-safe only for read operations, although a Biterator may be used to stream indices in an order and grouping appropriate for parallel manipulation of bits. Alternatively, a ConcurrentBitSet may be used to make all operations thread-safe, requiring no external synchronization at the cost of performance.

If size isn't a multiple of 64, there will be "hanging" bits that exist on the end of the last long within words, which are not accounted for by size. No exception will be thrown when these bit indices are manipulated or read, and in the aggregating functions population(), hashCode(), etc., any hanging bits will have their effect on those functions made consistent by cleanLastWord().

Otherwise, accessing a negative index, or any index greater than or equal to size will cause an IndexOutOfBoundsException to be thrown.

Author:
Aaron Shouldis
See Also:
ConcurrentBitSet

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean add​(int index)
    Ensures that the bit at the specified index is in the live state.

    Performs a global AND operation on all bits in this BitSet with those in the specified BitSet set.
    void andWord​(int wordIndex, long mask)
    Changes the long word at wordIndex within words to the result of an AND operation between the current value at the specified wordIndex within words and the specified mask.
    protected static long bitMask​(int index)
    Calculates a mask to represent the bit at which a specific index will be stored within a long word.
    protected void cleanLastWord()
    Changes the state of any "hanging bits" to the dead state in order to maintain their effect on aggregating functions (population(), etc).
    void clear​(int index)
    Changes the state of a bit at the specified index to the dead state.
    void clear​(int from, int to)
    Changes the state of all bits in the specified range to the dead state.
    void compareSize​(BitSet set)
    Compares the size of this BitSet with that of the other specified BitSet set.
    void copy​(BitSet set)
    Transforms this BitSet so that each bit matches the state of that in the give set.
    java.util.stream.IntStream dead()
    Creates a parallel-safe IntStream consisting of the indices of all dead bits within this BitSet using DeadBiterator.
    double density()
    Calculates what percentage of bits in this BitSet are in the live state.

    Calculates what percentage of bits in this BitSet are in the live state in the specified range.

    Calculates index divided by 64.

    Transforms each bit in this BitSet to the dead state.

  • Field Details

    • MASK

      public static final long MASK
      Long mask with all bits set. (0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF)
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • MOD_SIZE_MASK

      private static final int MOD_SIZE_MASK
      Mask used to compute potentially faster modulo operations. n % m is equivalent to n & (m -1) if n is positive, and m = 2k.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • LOG_2_SIZE

      private static final int LOG_2_SIZE
      log264. Used to relate bit indices to word indices through bit-shifting as an alternative to division or multiplication by 64.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • size

      public final int size
      The number of indices accessible by this BitSet. Indices 0 through size -1 are accessible.

    • wordCount

      public final int wordCount
      The number of long words contained by this BitSet. Equal to ceiling(size / 64) and words.length.

    • words

      protected final long[] words
      Array holding the long words whose bits are manipulated. Has length ceiling(size / 64). Though this has protected visibility, using methods such as getWord(int), setWord(int, long), andWord(int, long) is preferred over direct access.

  • Constructor Details

    • BitSet

      public BitSet​(int size)
      Creates a BitSet with the specified number of bits indices. Indices 0 through size -1 will be accessible. All bits are initially in the dead state.
      Parameters:
      size - the number of bit indices that this BitSet will hold.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if size is less than 0.

    • BitSet

      public BitSet​(BitSet set)
      Creates a BitSet which is a clone of the specified BitSet set. The copy will have an identical size, and will copy the contents of set's words through copy(BitSet).
      Parameters:
      set - the BitSet to copy.
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if set is null.

  • Method Details

    • add

      public boolean add​(int index)
      Ensures that the bit at the specified index is in the live state. If it is not, it will be changed.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the bit to change to the live state.
      Returns:
      whether or not this BitSet was changed as a result.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is negative, or greater than or equal to size.

    • remove

      public boolean remove​(int index)
      Ensures that the bit at the specified index is the dead state. If it is not, it will be changed.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the bit to change to the dead state.
      Returns:
      whether or not this BitSet was changed as a result.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is negative, or greater than or equal to size.

    • get

      public final boolean get​(int index)
      Checks the current state of the bit at the specified index. Returns true if the bit is in the live state, and false if it is not.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the bit to examine.
      Returns:
      whether the bit at the specified index is in the live state.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is negative or greater than or equal to size.

    • get

      public final int get​(int from, int to)
      Calculates the number of live bits in the specified range.
      Parameters:
      from - (inclusive) the index of the first bit to be checked.
      to - (exclusive) the end of the range of bits to be checked.
      Returns:
      the number of live bits inside the specified range, or 0 if from is greater than or equal to to.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if from or to are outside of the range 0 to size,

      Changes the state of a bit at the specified index to the live state.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the bit to change to the live state.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is negative, or greater than or equal to size.

    • set

      public final void set​(int from, int to)
      Changes the state of all bits in the specified range to the live state. No action is taken if from is greater than or equal to to.
      Parameters:
      from - (inclusive) the index of the first bit to be changed to the live state.
      to - (exclusive) the end of the range of bits to be changed to the live state.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if from or to are outside of the range 0 to size.

    • toggle

      public final void toggle​(int from, int to)

      Parameters:
      from - (inclusive) the index of the first bit to be toggled.
      to - (exclusive) the end of the range of bits to be toggled.

    • getWord

      public long getWord​(int wordIndex)
      Returns the long word at the specified wordIndex within words.
      Parameters:
      wordIndex - the index within words to read.
      Returns:
      the raw contents of words at the specified wordIndex.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if wordIndex is outside of the range 0 to ceiling(size / 64).

    • setWord

      public void setWord​(int wordIndex, long word)
      Changes the long word at the specified wordIndex within words, setting it to word.
      Parameters:
      wordIndex - the index within words to set.
      word - the long value to be set to words at wordIndex.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if wordIndex is outside of the range 0 to ceiling(size / 64).

    • setWordSegment

      public void setWordSegment​(int wordIndex, long word, long mask)
      Changes the long word at the specified wordIndex within words such that it retains the previous state of bits where the bits of mask are in the dead state, and takes on the value of bits in word where mask has bits in the live state.
      Parameters:
      wordIndex - the index within words to change.
      word - the new long value to be set to words.
      mask - the mask used to determine which bits from word will be applied.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if wordIndex is outside of the range 0 to ceiling(size / 64).

    • andWord

      public void andWord​(int wordIndex, long mask)
      Changes the long word at wordIndex within words to the result of an AND operation between the current value at the specified wordIndex within words and the specified mask.
      words[wordIndex] &= mask;
      Parameters:
      wordIndex - the index within words to perform the AND operation upon.
      mask - the mask to use in the AND operation on the current value at the specified wordIndex.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if wordIndex is outside of the range 0 to ceiling(size / 64).

    • orWord

      public void orWord​(int wordIndex, long mask)
      Changes the long word at wordIndex within words to the result of an OR operation between the current value at the specified wordIndex within words and the specified mask.
      words[wordIndex] |= mask;
      Parameters:
      wordIndex - the index within words to perform the OR operation upon.
      mask - the mask to use in the OR operation on the current value at the specified wordIndex.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if wordIndex is outside of the range 0 to ceiling(size / 64).

    • xorWord

      public void xorWord​(int wordIndex, long mask)
      Changes the long word at wordIndex within words to the result of an XOR operation between the current value at the specified wordIndex within words and the specified mask.
      words[wordIndex] ^= mask;
      Parameters:
      wordIndex - the index within words to perform the XOR operation upon.
      mask - the mask to use in the XOR operation on the current value at the specified wordIndex.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if wordIndex is outside of the range 0 to ceiling(size / 64).

      wordIndex - the index within words to perform the fill operation upon.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if wordIndex is outside of the range 0 to ceiling(size / 64).

      public void emptyWord​(int wordIndex)
      Changes the long word at wordIndex within words to 0, removing all bits in the live state.
      Parameters:
      wordIndex - the index within words to perform the empty operation upon.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if wordIndex is outside of the range 0 to ceiling(size / 64).

    • randomize

      public final void randomize​(Random random, int from, int to)
      Changes the state of all bits in the specified range randomly according to the density of the Random random. In contrast to xOrRandomize(Random) and xOrRandomize(Random, int, int), this method preserves that density. When using a uniformly distributed Random (as opposed to DensityRandom), this is unnecessary. No action is taken if from is greater than or equal to to.
      Parameters:
      random - the instance of Random used to randomize.
      from - (inclusive) the index of the first bit to be randomized.
      to - (exclusive) the end of the range of bits to be randomized.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if from or to are outside of the range 0 to size.
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if random is null.
      See Also:
      DensityRandom

    • randomize

      public final void randomize​(Random random)
      Changes the state of all bits randomly according to the density of the Random random. In contrast to xOrRandomize(Random) and xOrRandomize(Random, int, int), this method preserves that density, at a small cost to performance. When using a uniformly distributed Random (as opposed to DensityRandom), this is unnecessary.
      Parameters:
      random - the instance of Random used to randomize.
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if random is null.
      See Also:
      DensityRandom

    • xOrRandomize

      public final void xOrRandomize​(Random random, int from, int to)
      Performs an XOR operation on all bits in the specified range against random bits generated by the specified Random random. When using a non-uniformly distributed Random, namely DensityRandom, the resulting density of this BitSet can be estimated with the function:
      density(a) + density(b) - (2 * density(a) * density(b))
      No action is taken if from is greater than or equal to to.
      Parameters:
      random - the instance of Random used to randomize.
      from - (inclusive) the index of the first bit to be randomized.
      to - (exclusive) the end of the range of bits to be randomized.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if from or to are outside of the range 0 to size.
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if random is null.
      See Also:
      DensityRandom

    • xOrRandomize

      public final void xOrRandomize​(Random random)
      Performs an XOR operation on all bits against random bits generated by the specified Random random. When using a non-uniformly distributed Random, namely DensityRandom, the resulting density of this BitSet can be estimated with the function:
      density(a) + density(b) - (2 * density(a) * density(b))
      Parameters:
      random - the instance of Random used to randomize.
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if random is null.
      See Also:
      DensityRandom

    • nextLive

      public final int nextLive​(int index)
      Calculates the index of the next live bit after the specified index, including that index. All bits from that specified index, until size will be checked. If no live bits are found, -1 is returned.
      Parameters:
      index - (inclusive) the first index to check.
      Returns:
      the index of the next live bit, or -1 if none were found.

    • nextDead

      public final int nextDead​(int index)
      Calculates the index of the next dead bit after the specified index, including that index. All bits from that specified index, until size will be checked. If none are found, -1 is returned.
      Parameters:
      index - (inclusive) the first index to check.
      Returns:
      the index of the next dead bit, or -1 if none were found.

    • lastLive

      public final int lastLive​(int index)
      Calculates the index of the most recent live bit before the specified index, including that index. If none are found, -1 is returned.
      Parameters:
      index - (inclusive) the first index to check.
      Returns:
      the index of the next live bit, or -1 if none were found.

    • lastDead

      public final int lastDead​(int index)
      Calculates the index of the most recent dead bit before the specified index, including that index. If none are found, -1 is returned.
      Parameters:
      index - (inclusive) the first index to check.
      Returns:
      the index of the next dead bit, or -1 if none were found.

      public final java.util.stream.IntStream live()

      Returns:
      a parallel-safe IntStream representation of live indices.

      public final java.util.stream.IntStream dead()

      Returns:

      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the sizes of both BitSets are not equal.
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if set is null.

    • not

      public final void not​(BitSet set)
      Transforms this BitSet into the complement of the specified set.
      Parameters:
      set - the other BitSet from which to perform the NOT operation.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the sizes of both BitSets are not equal.
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if set is null.

    • not

      public final void not()
      Transforms each bit in this BitSet into the complement of its current state.

    • fill

      public final void fill()
      Transforms each bit in this BitSet to the live state.

    • empty

      public final void empty()
      Transforms each bit in this BitSet to the dead state.

    • copy

      public final void copy​(BitSet set)
      Transforms this BitSet so that each bit matches the state of that in the give set.
      Parameters:
      set - the other BitSet from which to copy.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the sizes of both BitSets are not equal.
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if set is null.

    • cleanLastWord

      protected final void cleanLastWord()
      Changes the state of any "hanging bits" to the dead state in order to maintain their effect on aggregating functions (population(), etc).

    • nextLiveBit

      private final int nextLiveBit​(long word, int wordIndex)
      Calculates the index of the next live bit within a specified word that is at the specified wordIndex within words. This index will represent its bit index in the underlying long array as well as the offset within the long word.
      Parameters:
      word - the long word to be checked for a live bit.
      wordIndex - the index of the word within words.
      Returns:
      the index of the next live bit within the specified word, or -1 if none is found.

    • lastLiveBit

      private final int lastLiveBit​(long word, int wordIndex)
      Calculates the index of the recent-most live bit within a specified word that is at the specified wordIndex within words. This index will represent its bit index in the underlying long array as well as the offset within the long word.
      Parameters:
      word - the long word to be checked for a live bit.
      wordIndex - the index of the word within words.
      Returns:
      the index of the recent-most live bit within the specified word.

    • compareSize

      public final void compareSize​(BitSet set)
      Compares the size of this BitSet with that of the other specified BitSet set. Enforces that they are equal, throwing a IllegalArgumentException otherwise.
      Parameters:
      set - the BitSet to compare sizes with.
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if set is null.
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the sizes are different.

    • population

      public final int population()
      Calculates the number of live bits within this BitSet.
      Returns:
      the number of live bits.

    • density

      public final double density​(int from, int to)
      Calculates what percentage of bits in this BitSet are in the live state in the specified range. No action is taken if from is greater than or equal to to.
      Parameters:
      from - (inclusive) the index of the first bit to be checked.
      to - (exclusive) the end of the range of bits to be checked.
      Returns:
      the percentage of live bits.

    • density

      public final double density()
      Calculates what percentage of bits in this BitSet are in the live state.
      Returns:
      the percentage of live bits.

    • divideSize

      public static final int divideSize​(int index)
      Calculates index divided by 64. Equivalent to the index of the word corresponding to the specified index.
      Parameters:
      index - the index to divide by 64.
      Returns:
      wordIndex / 64.

    • multiplySize

      public static final int multiplySize​(int wordIndex)
      Calculates wordIndex multiplied by 64. Equivalent to the first index of the word at the specified wordIndex.
      Parameters:
      wordIndex - the index to multiply by 64.
      Returns:
      wordIndex * 64.

    • modSize

      public static final int modSize​(int index)
      Equivalent to index % 64 for positive numbers, and modulo of positive numbers faster.
      Parameters:
      index - the index to perform the modulo operation upon.
      Returns:
      the result of the modulo operation.
      See Also:
      MOD_SIZE_MASK

    • bitMask

      protected static final long bitMask​(int index)
      Calculates a mask to represent the bit at which a specific index will be stored within a long word.
      Parameters:
      index - the index to represent as a bit.
      Returns:
      the bit that represents the position of an index within a word.
